reference.title: Origin
reference.shortdesc: The origins element can be a root element to define the contract a token uses, but can also be inside attributes to get the source of an attribute, like through an ethereum call.

refbody.refsyn: The origins element is usually used at two occasions: First, at the beginnung of a TokenScript to define the underlying smart contract, like DAI. Second, to get the value of an Attribute.

p.b: Get an attribute value from a user entry
p.codeblock: <ts:attribute name="amount"> <ts:type> <ts:syntax>1.3.6.1.4.1.1466.115.121.1.36</ts:syntax> </ts:type> <ts:label> <ts:string xml:lang="en">Amount in DAI</ts:string> <ts:string xml:lang="zh">代幣金額</ts:string> </ts:label> <ts:origins> <ts:user-entry as="e18"/> </ts:origins> </ts:attribute>
